12122.content:
Head throbbing with a dull ache left by whatever sedatives had been in the gas, Anna slowly picked herself up off the floor of the tube. When first stepping inside, she had felt a quiet, humming vibration through her feet. The machine was still and quiet now and only the faint glow of the display panel told her that it still worked. A pang of anxious fear trembled through her at the thought of being stuck here. Wherever - or whenever, rather - that was.
 
The room beyond stood in dilapidated ruin. Cobwebs hung in thick sheets from the sagging ceiling; broken and collapsed support beams letting twisted tangles of debris press down into the room. The drywall had long-ago rotted away, the bared cinder-blocks cracked and fallen in at places. Roots snaked across a floor that was layered in dust where it wasn't covered in dirt. The air hung heavy with the stench of mold, mildew and must; every breath made Anna want to wrinkle her nose in disgust. It was warm, at least, if slightly damp. Moisture leaking in from above and through the gaps in the wall had allowed a wealth of tiny creepers and fungi to flourish. Several luminescent varieties provided a faint, phosphorous light to pervade.
 
Heart pounding fit to explode, her stomach fluttering queasily, Anna pressed herself up against the back wall of the tube. This couldn't be happening; this wasn't real. Time machines didn't actually exist; they were only in books or movies. She must have hit her head when the gas knocked her out. The whole "spinning clock hands" thing must have been some kind of trick. A...a projection against the glass door or something.
 
         "Okay Anna, time to wake up now," she said shakily, feeling her knees start to tremble. Nothing happened and with each passing second that she felt that she was indeed awake, that this was not a dream and that the time machine she'd blithely walked into was real, she felt her grip on herself crumbling. The world seemed to spin as disbelief gave way to panic. Chest tightening, her whole body trembling, each breath grew quick and frantic. Madly, she threw herself at the glowing console jabbing at it blindly with shaking fingers. A message in blocky blue lettering suddenly scrolled across the display. POWER SOURCE DEPLETED. RECHARGING. TIME TO FULL CHARGE: 144 HRS.
 
A strangled cry of anguish and dismay burst out of Anna's mouth. Her knees buckled and she slumped to the floor, already feeling the first sobs overwhelming her. For long minutes she sat and cried, knees hugged tight to her chest and her face buried in them. She was stuck here. For an entire week she was trapped in this unknown future; this unknown world. For a time she contemplated just sitting there for all six days, un-moving, until the stupid machine was ready to work again. A useless idea, she knew. She'd skipped lunch and was killing time until supper when she'd discovered the secret room and the machine within. She'd be hungry before long and even if she thought she could tough out six days without food, she'd need water before then.
 
Drying her tears and steeling her resolve, Anna climbed back up to her feet. Tentatively she stepped out, shivering at the cool ground underfoot. She spared a moment looking hopefully for her clothes before sighing in mute acceptance that, however far into the future the machine had taken her, they too were long rotted away. She hoped maybe some of her other clothes had survived; tucked away in her dresser or even in the pile she sometimes ended up kicking under her bed to get her dad to stop nagging. There was no telling what kinds of dangers she might run into and the thought of facing them naked made her almost nauseous with worry. Not that simple clothing would offer much protection but at the very least they'd make her feel better about her situation.
 
Directly across from her, the doorway that led into the room stood partially blocked by debris. Crouching down to peer through, it looked as though there was a tight but clear passage back to her bedroom. What was left of her bedroom, anyway. Just off to her left, a broken spar of floor beam and part of the floor above slanted down almost to the ground. More beams and broken chunks and wood and brick had fallen in around it but there appeared to be a very narrow, twisting space through to the floor above. Short and slim as she was, Anna thought she might be able to climb up and squirm her way through.
 
         Which way does Anna go?
12122.title: After world

121222.content:
Eyeing the jagged ends of splintered wood and hard edges of tumbled debris choking the narrow shaft, Anna turns away. Just looking at tight, twisting bends and turns made her skin crawl. The last thing she wanted to do was take unnecessary risks with her health in this foreign world. All it would take is one wrong move to leave her scraped up and bleeding. She doubted that medical supplies were in abundance and an infection could cripple or kill her. No, much better to play it safe.
 
Brushing away the cobwebs, Anna crouched low to slip through the partially-blocked door into the short hallway. More roots had managed to work their way through the walls and ceiling here and she splashed through shallow puddles of rank, tepid water. Mosses and fungi grew in abundance here and insects skittered away with each careful step she took. Heavy with dust, the webs resisted her passage, falling back to brush across her shoulders and back. The thick mats tickled faintly and Anna couldn't help the few snickered giggles that slipped out of her.
 
The passage was short and she quickly reached the sliding wall panel that had originally hidden the secret room from her. The mechanisms holding the panel had decayed and collapsed with age, leaving the panel itself leaning askew across the opening. Reaching out, Anna tried sliding it aside. Time and mounding debris had stuck it in place, however and it simply quivered at her tentative shove. Frowning, she adjusted her grip and tried again, grunting with the strain. The panel had to move. If it didn't, the, she'd be left with no choice but to brave the twisting shaft.
 
Fumbling around in the dim light, Anna's foot came down on a patch of slick, muddy water. With a squealing yelp her feet shoot out to one side and she toppled forward. There was a loud, hollow THUMP as her shoulder cracked against the panel and a dry, crackling groan as it was dislodged and fell inward. Time slowed to a crawl, her eyes widening in alarm. She watched the panel fall, already bracing herself for the...
 
CRASH
 
Cringing against the resounding rattle of the panel slamming to the floor, Anna stood frozen, barely daring to breathe in the ensuing silence. Massive clouds of dust billowed up, sweeping into the narrow passage and blinding her. Recoiling, Anna threw a protective hand in front of her face, doubling over from the forceful sneeze that wracked her in the dust cloud's wake. The dust was everywhere, suffocating as it filled her nose and mouth, bringing on a fit of sneezes and coughing.
Scrambling through into the ruins of her bedroom, Anna half-collapsed against the wall; coughing, sneezing and gasping frantically for air.
 
Long minutes passed before Anna managed to straighten, still coughing fitfully. Almost at once she felt her heart sink and a hard lump form in her throat. The shelves that had once held her treasured nick-knacks and mementos were gone; fallen to the floor and rotted away if not carried off by scavengers. Scattered shards of glass and ceramic ground into the dirt and filth layered across the floor were all that remained. In the far corner, only a few splintered chunks - too small to be of use - was all that was left of her dresser. In the other corner, near the door, a corner of empty mirror frame jutted up from a pile of fallen debris where her vanity once sat. Directly to her left, the bare metal frame of her bed, turned solidly to rust, lay upon the ground; one corner tilted up slightly where the frame had become twisted. Graffiti was painted across every open surface of wall available. Overlapping three or four times in places, parts of words or pictures were cut off where sections of wall had fallen in later. 133.content:
With trembling steps, Anna tiptoes into the still, silent room. It appears to be an old, dusty closet or other storage area. While most 15 year old girls might consider such a find of no importance, Anna's love for mysteries kicks-in, and she's excited to see what she might find amidst the various forgotten old items.

With only the glimmer of light from her room to guide her, Anna retreats back from the entrance and bounds up the basement stairs to the kitchen to grab the flashlight out of the closet. Flashlight in hand, Anna stops long enough while upstairs to ascertain what she'd already expected: As usual, her Dad and older siblings were off busy doing whatever people with busy lives tended to do.

Excitedly, Anna leaves a message with her best friend since the family arrived in the area, the even smaller and shyer Korean exchange-student, Kim: "Kimmy! It's Banana! Guess what?!? I just discovered a secret room off of my bedroom in the basement! Call me back when you get home from your little brother's birthday party, kay?".

And with that, she again heads downstairs. Flashlight clutched in both hands, she again tiptoes down into the cluttered room. It appears to be furnishings and garments from at least a century prior, although most of the antiques are draped by heavy sheets. Seemingly drawn to a tall stand of some sort, Anna removes the canvas covering to reveal a beautiful full-length mirror.

Gazing at her reflection, she feels a sudden wave of faintness. She manages to keep her balance, and is dumbstruck as the reflection in the mirror begins to not only move of it's own accord, but to change in unusual ways. It's still her Anna views in the murky, dark glass, but it's a version of herself in another time and place, in very different circumstances:

Choice 1: She envisions herself as Nnaa the Leopard Girl, springing through the forests and jungles like some feral offspring of the big-cats, leading them to protect the jungles of some alternate world.

Choice 2: She envisions herself as Aann, one of the beautiful, winged nymphs of the Tryphidian Forests of Glarmus-19.

Choice 3: Other? Think up some other alternate version of Anna

It was just about the most bulky and bizarre-looking piece of equipment Anna had ever laid eyes on, but there was no doubt it was a gun, designed to shoot... something. It had a very large barrel (four to five inches wide,) a trigger that looked more like a pump, and a very, very big container (bigger than the gun itself) attached to the back, holding the ammo she assumed.

She was afraid to even walk near it, but out of curiosity (and hopes that it wouldn't spontaneously fire) she did so anyway and saw what was apparently a manual right next to it. Anna wasn't one to read through a long-winded booklet like this, but it was probably the only way to know what this gun even did. It read;

"Section 1: Introduction
This is the DoMC's Direct-force Incontinence Appealing Personally-operated Enforcement of Re-ordered Society Distributor device."

"What a mouthful!" Anne thought to herself as she continued reading what was an even bigger mouthful; pretty much a wall of text that she only read because of her incredible curiosity. (However, you may skip this long paragraph if you like.)

"By observing the picture below, or simply viewing the device itself; you will see a large, white container in the back of the device. This holds up to 6.4 gallons of the DoMC owned 'Paddglue,' by pulling the trigger in the middle of the device, .75 gallons of Paddglue will be fired out the cannon in the front of the device alongside another creation of the DoMC; the 'Level 7 matter annihilator flying titanium shock-wave grenade.' After the grenade (soon followed by the Paddglue) are fired from the device, it will travel up to 50 feet until it hits a target. The device was designed for its targets to be the midsection of up-standing humans, first the grenade will erupt as soon as it hits the desired human, sending a 1.5 foot range shock-wave that will decentigrate any clothing the human is wearing (or any body hair the human has) in that range. If timing and aiming is done correctly (which it is %99.6 percent of the time in practical scenarios) the Paddglue (which is like a hot liquid, almost like yogurt only it sticks to itself and to anything it touches) will then hit the bare skin of the human and wrap around their crotch, essentially like underwear. But now that the Paddglue is being exposed to oxygen, it is rapidly cooling down and expanding into a solid. Thus causing it to "fluff up" around the human, after 5 to 7 seconds, the Paddglue would have finished expanding and is now a highly absorbent material (waterproof on the outermost layer, the same way bread crust is formed) and is in every way a usable diaper to the human. The only difference from a regular diaper is that this is all one piece, and is very difficult to take off. This main feature of the device can be used to break up crowds of mobs or to simply get people's attention. Please read full manual before using. Copyright the DoMC 1994."

Anne laid the manual down in amazement, hardly believing what she had just read, and still trying to wrap her head around it. But after a while of thought, she gathered that this device actually shoots a diaper right onto someone simply by aiming and firing at them. Not only that, but it removes the clothing around the required area beforehand. A crazy concept all the way, but considering the insane look of the gun, maybe it really did?
